hymn.title: A little bird I am
hymn.category: Comfort in Trials—By Enjoyment in Suffering

creators.author: Madame Jeanne-Marie Bouvier de la Motte-Guyon
creators.composer: From Hymns of Worship and Remembrance

lyrics.stanza: A little bird I am, Shut from the fields of air, And in my cage I sit and sing To Him who placed me there; Well pleased a prisoner to be, Because, my God, it pleaseth Thee.
O it is good to soar These bolts and bars above! To Him whose purpose I adore, Whose providence I love; And in Thy mighty will to find The joy, the freedom of the mind.
